TopicTitle: Mission control received a transmission from Laythe

Articles.Content:
Hey everybody,

My mission control center received this message and I'm not quite sure, if my Kerbals on board of their rover and lander are in distress or save and sound.

What do you guys think?

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cftzbshviwoxve3/SSTV-Laythe.wav

Cheers
This sounds exactly the same as the one that comes from the south pole of Duna. Might be a bit different
Someone, Quick run it on the audio to picture thing! ITS A NEW EASTEREGG! OMGOMGOMGOMG1!!212!2121@!!!!!1!!1!!!
Looks to me like they're doing just fine:

Someone should make a mission control mod where your crews send sstv messages and you have to decode them and you can send them back another code, would add some awesome realism and make the home-made campaigns even more realistic especially if you needed a satellite network to send them to distant places,
I'm sure that something similar is coming from Squad, otherwise there wouldn't have been a reason to implement short and long range antennas in the first place.

Wow! At first I thought "obvious troll is obvious"

And then I saw the pic.

Nice one OP
The picture actually looks so distorted, that it's hard to recognize it as a picture from a game and not a real one.
Wow, Was not expecting that. Well done.
I'm sure that these SSTV signals will become some important plot point in career mode. I am thinking of them being clues to some hidden ship/technology for travelling to other star systems possibly.
